comments:
I200403240800
MacOS 10.2.8 (Jaguar)

- launch Eclipse
- switch to Java perspective
- create new launch config for "Run-time workbench"
- run
Observe: new Dock entry appears for a brief moment, but run-time eclipse won't start.
There are no entries in .log or on the console. There seem to be no VM crashes.

Please note:
- I'm not sure whether this is platform.core
- these same steps work under Panther (10.3.3) without problems
- in Yesterday's build (200403231600) selfhosting works without problems on Panther and Jaguar!

Andre, are you starting with -consolelog?

If no, could you try that and see if anything is logged to the console?

Note that if the workbench does not have a chance to run or fails early, the log
location will be inside the configuration area, which is deleted by default by
PDE (see bugs 56002, 56025).

Oops, I used the -consoleLog with the outer Eclipse, not with the run-time....

With a -consoleLog I get:

!SESSION Mar 24, 2004 22:54:14.303 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1_01
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=en_US
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Mar 24, 2004 22:54:14.341
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/swt/widgets/Synchronizer
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createDisplay(PlatformUI.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:288)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:232)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:116)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:315)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:724)

which I don't really understand because the same runs on Panther.

Could you try running on Panther and checking whether the bootloader constants
are the same?
*** Bug 56367 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Since this only happens on Jaguar and since we don't have to support Eclipse 3.0 on Jaguar,
I'm lowering the severity to Normal.

Please note that the .log file in Bug 56367 was obtained using either Panther 
or Jaguar.
*** Bug 58161 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I finally have my "runtime workbench" running. It wasn't the update of the OS (from 10.3 (7B85) to 
10.3.3), it was the update of java (from 1.4.1 to 1.4.2) that seemed to make the diffference for me. 
Possibly it was the combination of both updates. Don't know if there is any work planned for this bug, 
but thought this info might be helpful.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 64616 ***
